meanings.definition: Make (a problem, bad situation, or negative feeling) worse.
meanings.sent1: His loud music only exacerbates my headache.
meanings.sent2: The lack of rain will exacerbate the drought in the region.
meanings.sent3: Trying to fix the leaky faucet only seemed to exacerbate the situation.
meanings.sent4: Her constant complaints exacerbate the tension in the office.
meanings.sent5: The harsh words only served to exacerbate the already fragile relationship.

meanings.sent1: The constant noise from the construction site exacerbates my irritation.
meanings.sent2: His teasing remarks never fail to exacerbate her anger.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy seemed to exacerbate the grumpy old cat.
meanings.sent4: The persistent buzzing of the mosquito exacerbated her annoyance.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive tapping on the desk only served to exacerbate her frustration.
